intro: Conostegia setifera, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the dry season. Its leaves are narrow and covered with fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Conostegia setifera is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or inland dune habitats.
